Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Matthias it went down from 1.21% to 1.19%, so not much at all. We are still trying to get the word out. It could also be that most of those funds are from people years ago, that lost the wallet.dat, or are dead, or will never care to move their funds. It's hard to say how much of that is "lost" or just "hasn't been moved"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Matthias> @dukeleto true, makes you wonder how many of the funds in t-addr are also ‚Äúlost‚Äù.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> estimates are that something like 25% of BTC is "lost"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> nobody really knows stat for HUSH, but we know people lose computers, hard drives fail, houses burn down, so the number of lost coins is definitely > 0, and a large % of those zaddrs could be "lost coins", we can never really know for sure

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ```
$ time ./hush_stats
71320.15324607, 1.19

real    0m10.165s
user    0m1.116s
sys     0m0.020s
```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> pretty much the same. Slightly higher by 0.23 HUSH

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that could potentially be people attempting to play with sprout zaddrs and exploit the bug, but, at least to me, it is not evidence of exploitation. Why go to all that trouble to counterfeit 0.01 USD worth of HUSH?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c do you have an explanation of why we are seeing tiny increase in sprout funds? Maybe z->t change somehow? We follow upstream ZEC's coinbase-must-go-thru-shielded-pool rule, could that be related?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <scubapanda> Someone needing to use viewing key..

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> is sprout tx disabled?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <scubapanda> Or is Sapling-T-Sprout impossible now? @dukeleto

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c no, sprout xtns are still valid

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if they weren't, all HUSH in zaddrs would be locked already. Currently 1.19% of supply

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> then any usage of zaddr on HUSH would increase the supply

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c i thought that t->z would increase that number, and z->t would decrease that number

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> with z->z leaving it the same

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> this is how I am calculating it, maybe it's just dead wrong: https://github.com/leto/Util/blob/master/bin/hush_stats#L22

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ` shielded_supply = gettxoutsetinfo.total_amount - getsnapshot.total` is what I am using

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but i guess i am not taking into account new supply

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> that is correct

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> not sure if coinbase needs to be shielded

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ok, i figured it was something like that. my estimate is not perfect, just an estimate

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> BLOCK 500,000 (~42 days from now) will be the Hush snapshot, onto our new KMD asset chain. Any funds left in zaddrs will be locked onto the original Hush chain.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <heguli97> Looks cool :), so am i understanding this correctly that after the fork Hush will become a kmd asset chain coin kind of like BTCH?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I am making my upstream KMD instead of ZEC, because I like that much better

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I disagree with a lot of things ZEC is doing

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and also I want cryptoconditions for Hush, and many things that ZEC doesn't have

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and also sapling

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> BTCH has sapling already, all KMD ac's got upgraded

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Eddy O> I said one sentence in like a week. You really use "FUD" in your everyday vocabulary?

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Fear, Uncertainty, Doubt

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I appreciate constructive criticism, but FUD, I don't

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:

I think more important are your motivations. You're the only one in control and have been for over a year.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Eddy O my motivations are such that I care enough about Hush to not let it die of abandonment many months ago, and mostly I just hear from people like you that I don't do enough

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Eddy O> Working out will help your mental health, Duke. "Corporate overlands" lol.

Community voted improvements, paid for by bounties were your concerns. Proposal was not by me, but by many people- I just collected the ideas and supported them by saying I would fund the first bounties. Out of the 5 transactions I've made using hush blockchain, they have all been donations to the members of hush team, now gone. Only you remain from when I first bought hush.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <RunningMantheCoin> @Eddy O please understand that Hush is in a transition process which will result in major new improvements. If you want to help out feel free- but keep it classy in the discord please ‚úåüèΩ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I am working with various mining pools to make sure we can transition mining of HUSH smoothly  over to a new chain. Once a few pools have migrated and things stabilize, we will be set for exchanges to upgrade to the latest Hush chain and then re-enable trading. @Berg @RunningMantheCoin and others have been doing lots behind the scenes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> once we start the new chain, we will get a new KMD-based insight explorer, so it doesn't make sense to mess with our current insight explorer in the mean-time.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> i am working with mining pools to make sure then enable sapling zaddr payout addresses, which is an exciting improvement

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gilardh if you are willing to help coordinate it, I would like to see https://myhush.org/sapling/ get translated into a few languages. I am willing to provide a bounty for you to manage translations of that page, and for people that submit translations. It's an important notice to translate, currently it's only described in English, which is not friendly to most people in the world
